us-bibliographic-data-application.invention-title: FOAM PIECE ATTACHED TO A CLIP THAT SLIDES ONTO THE INSIDE OF THE HAT TO KEEP HEAD COOL

abstract.p: Foam piece attached to a clip that slides onto the inside of the hat to keep head cool. is disclosed.

description.heading: CROSS-REFERENCE TO RELATED APPLICATION
description.p: This application claims the benefit of priority of U.S. provisional application No. 63/161,809, filed Mar. 16, 2021, the contents of which are herein incorporated by reference.
description.heading: BACKGROUND OF THE INVENTION
description.p: Problem Solved: Hot head while wearing hats, with no air flow. Human sweating.

description.heading: DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF THE INVENTION
description.p: As stated above, Hot head while wearing hats, with no air flow. Human sweating. The invention claimed here solves this problem.
Clip attaches to the inside of the sweatband in the hat, and the foam on the other side goes against head creates an airway to keep the head cooler.
The claimed invention differs from what currently exists.
This invention is an improvement on what currently exists.

The Version of the Invention Discussed Here Includes:
1. Plastic Clip with gripping teeth on the inside
2. Piece of foam that attaches to clip

How the Invention Works:
#1 Clip had tension and stays tight to sweatband
#2 Foam attaches to clip and goes against forehead, which slightly lifts hat off forehead allowing airflow
Step 1 grab hat sweatband firmly
Step 2 slide clip onto sweatband
Step 3 press clip down fully onto sweatband
Plastic clip is made from mold process.
Foam is cut into small pieces.
The foam may be attached to the hat by any suitable means, such as the clip, adhesive, hook and loop closure, and combinations thereof. It's possible to add air, air bags.
Creates gap between sweatbands of hat and head. To allow airflow and keep you cooler.
Additionally: Foam could be used in clothing to allow airflow in specific parts of clothing where people sweat. Also, airbags could be used in these areas of clothing.

claim.claim-text: 1. A hat spacer comprising:a foam pad andan attachment means adhered thereto;wherein said attachment means is operative to removably attach the hat spacer to a sweatband component of a hat; andwherein the attachment means is selected from the group consisting of clip, adhesive, hook and loop closure, and combinations thereof.
